arts.ttl: Reading fan favourite ruled out for month with returning knee injury
arts.sum: Reading defender Amadou Mbengue is set to miss the next month with a knee injury, potentially ruling him out of the season. The 23-year-old is a firm fan favourite but has struggled in 2025 with his knee. Out for most of January, the Royals star will likely now miss another month. This comes just a week after fellow defender Michael Craig was ruled out for the season with injury. "We picked up a few injuries," Hunt said after Saturdays' 1-1 draw with Crawley Town. "Amadou in the game previously and Louie [Holzman] got a contact injury yesterday. Stickers game in and did great. To not be around as much as he would’ve liked but come in and do well."

arts.ttl: 'Two points dropped' says Reading boss after late Crawley Town equaliser
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt believed it was 'two points dropped' in a low-quality 1-1 draw with Crawley Town. The Royals conceded an 89th-minute goal at Crawley to draw 1-1, dropping two vital points in the race for the play-offs. Extending the unbeaten run to eight matches, the Royals failed to threaten the Red Devils in the second half, despite Rob Elliott's side looking set for relegation to League Two. "We felt it was going to be a scrappy game," Hunt said after the draw. "I thought we dealt with them well and kept them out of the box until the last minute. We dropped too deep and were a little bit loose in terms of the first and second ball and let the cross come in. We’ve been so good in the last seven or eight games so I’m disappointed to not have the three points.

arts.ttl: Late show earns Crawley a point against Reading
arts.sum: Reading had gone ahead in the first half.

arts.ttl: Reading drop points late on in play-off race to relegation threatened Crawley Town
arts.sum: A low-quality affair, Reading took control of the early stages without ever truly testing what was a shaky Joe Wollcaott in the home net. Inside 10 minutes Camara charged down the keeper, with the former Swindon stopper mistiming his kick and delivering straight to Charlie Savage. Finding Billy Bodin in the box, the Burton Albion loanee was the latest of many to be flagged offside in a stop-start opening. The hosts certainly had half-chances but lacked a clinical nature, showing exactly why they sit second from bottom in League One. Former Nottingham Forest youngster Will Swann had a good individual game up against Abrefa, setting Tyreece John-Jules up in the box only for the forward to give away a throw-in with his attempted finish. Meandering along in the spring sunshine, Ehibhatiomhan gave the 1,400 supporters something to cheer about as his clever touch and finish on the half-hour mark opened the scoring. Reading got into the break with the slender lead but still gave away chances. John-Jules and Swann caused trouble in the right-hand channel but inviting crosses were flashed across the box with no takers in red. Toby Mularkey had the last effort of the half, curling a strike narrowly wide of Joel Pereira’s post from the edge of the box.

arts.ttl: Live updates: Reading look to make it eight games unbeaten in Crawley Town trip
arts.sum: Reading look to keep up with the play-off sides with a result at relegation-threatened Crawley Town this lunchtime. More than 1,400 supporters are braving the M25 closures to be present at the Broadfield Community Stadium. Unbeaten in six matches, the Royals are four points outside the top six heading into the match.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Three changes for Crawley Town trip as star defender drops out
arts.sum: Reading are heading to Crawley Town without the services of star defender Amadou Mbengue. The 23-year-old is a fan favourite and was nominated for Player of the Month for February, however he is one of three changes made by Noel Hunt for this afternoon's trip to Crawley. Joel Pereira starts in goal, looking for a third clean sheet in four matches.

arts.ttl: Former Reading midfielder 'training' with Derby County ahead of Championship return
arts.sum: Former Reading midfielder Jeff Hendrick is training with Championship side Derby County, manager John Eustace has confirmed. The 33-year-old has not played for 12 months since leaving Newcastle United and spent the 2022/23 campaign with the Royals, making nearly 50 appearances as the club were relegated to League One. Aside from a 12 match spell with Sheffield Wednesday last season, Hendrick has not played week-in and week-out since departing the SCL Stadium.

arts.ttl: Cyriel Dessers reading same Rangers script as Jose Mourinho as Ibrox urged to drown out comeback chat
arts.sum: The big striker helped fillet Fenerbahce in Istanbul but warns Turks will be team on a mission in Glasgow for return leg

arts.ttl: Berkshire MPs speak out in Parliament during Reading and Football Governance debate
arts.sum: Every Member of Parliament for constituencies in Berkshire spoke up in favour of the Football Governance Bill in Westminster Hall on Thursday. MP for Woodley and Earley, Yuan Yang, called for more powers for the Government’s Independent Football Regulator, the legislation for which has been stalled by Conservative peers in the House of Lords. Prior to the debate, Ms. Yang launched a petition with fan groups Sell Before We Dai and the Supporters Trust at Reading calling for a Parliamentary inquiry to hold Reading’s absent owners to account. The petition reached 10,000 signatures in just a week.

Crawley were heading for a crucial victory at Lincoln on Tuesday after going ahead, but a collapse from then on in saw them lose again and slip seven points from safety. The Red Devils have only won ...
